title.label: Just like Total Annihilation for PC

content.label: I had flashbacks of playing Total Annihilation, the game that Supreme Commander was born from.  Controls are pretty good so that playing the game does not end in rage quit.  It is actually very fun to play.  1-hour campaigns fly by.  The only downside is that there is no campaign mode, only randomized skirmishes.  I don't mind, but some people might want some kind of story.  Build up the nuke and watch the glow!

title.label: THE prime RTS for iOS gamers!

content.label:
This is my first app review, ever, but I felt it was worth it for the epicness provided by LASW. Where do I start? For a buck it will easily become your favorite iOS app if you have even a passing interest in RTS games. The gameplay is excellent, reminiscent of Supreme Commander, the terrain is beautiful, the procedurally generated maps are a plus, and the unit choice is nothing to sniff at. Also, the dev, or at least the person on the other end of isotope's email help line said that Machines at War 3 will be coming soon to iOS devices as well, and that it will have multiplayer. 

That does, unfortunately, lead me into the part of the app that I don't quite like so much. No app is perfect, and LASW is no exception, despite how pretty it is. I would say no multiplayer support is my biggest gripe. Especially since after a while the bots become easy to beat unless you start giving them bonuses. But, MaW 3 is coming, and like I said above, that is supposed to have multiplayer, so I will wait on that and see. Secondly, the terrain is too flat. Everything is pretty, but there are no mountains, hills, valleys, or anything, really. And I can understand how hard something like that is to add, especially when you're going with procedurally generated maps, but it does break realism somewhat. Thirdly, player colors (or lack thereof) is something of a sticking point for me. The interface for choosing payer color, while basing it on world nations gives it sort of a "Monday Night Combat" feel to it, and that's a positive, the interface itself is somewhat hard to discern...perhaps a suggestion would be to highlight each nation with the color you will be if you choose said nation. 

And then, I think my last negative point would have to be on unit behavior and path finding. Again, two of the most complex parts of an RTS, so I am sympathetic, but a review is to comment on good and bad, so here goes. The path finding needs some work. Units, when clumped, tend to get stuck and then just stall out, unsure of where to go. This is particularly noticeable with land units, if you move them in a group or if they encounter a structure, it's not uncommon to see a dozen or so tanks in that column of twenty you just dispatched sitting around, twiddling their thumbs. Then, secondly, as mentioned by another reviewer, there doesn't really seem to be a whole lot of unit autonomy, forcing a lot of micromanagement. 

This could be mitigated somewhat by having some kind of intermediate zoom function, without necessitating going clear back to the strategic map to get a view of the battlefield, but as mentioned, it's frustrating to see a gaggle of Newts sitting around some damaged units, not repairing them, or to see a squad of tanks not attacking the power plants, because they don't register high enough on their threat priorities.

However, this in no way detracts from the whole of the game. For RTS on a tablet or other portable device, it is simply unparalleled. As a SupCom player, I admit I am somewhat picky when it comes to my RTS's...I like things big, and I like combined arms, and not many RTS's in the PC can boast that, much less on a tablet. Seeing a wing of Raptors come take out that gunship that was harassing your Spec Mine while you send a fleet of destroyers to do the same to your enemy is a thing of beauty. A column of tanks rolling inexorably towards the enemy stronghold is frightening if you're on the receiving end, and absolutely glorious if you sent them yourself. Everything about this game screams awesome, from the way you tech up, to the sheer scale of it all. So in conclusion, LASW is a must have for any strategy gamer, heck, any gamer, period. You will NOT be disappointed. Have I said how awesome it is enough yet? :-P

EDIT: As an addendum, I must comment on how amazing the AI is. I didn't think that it was very challenging, but that's because I had yet to fully explore the difficulty levels. In the Robotic level with a bit of a bonus, even as low as 10%, I found that a four-way battle went from taking around an hour to over four hours in length! Attacks and counter attacks were flying all across the map and it was almost impossible to get a steady base established because the AI harassment was absolutely ridiculous. I've said it before and I'll say it again; if you're looking for an RTS to sate your addiction on a tablet or mobile device, LASW is the game for you, and when MaW3 comes out with multiplayer, it will easily become the top game on iOS devices everywhere.
They took out the cancel button please put it back and if you can take out the background music

title.label: Top 3 favorite iPhone games of All Time

content.label: Enough said.
More units and multiplayer would be great too. As someone else said infantry seems like a good idea, but I don't think it would play out very well.

M. U. L. T. I. P. l. A. Y. E. R!!!!!!!

(Bluetooth, Local Wi-Fi and Internet!!!!!)

Also make an option to mute the music

I wish you can change the computers nation along with zoom in and out button so you would be able to see your nation more clearly. Also have a custom game place a nation and yours any where and how powerful each computer is and how aggressive they all are our how much the want peace to research to destroy his enemy. And also make the population limit go above 500 it won't work on iPhone 5.
For all the hype it has though I expected more. Multiplayer would be a nice addition.
Can u add more units and maybe some powers

I've had this game for a long time and not once have I had it crash on me. This is one of the only good platform war games that us good. There should be multiplayer playing with Game Center or random people near you that would be amazing. The price is perfect. You could add in more units and a upgrade factory that can upgrade a certain type of unit in that game. Over all exempt for those things this is in my top 5 favorite games!
This is by far my favorite game but it needs infantry and I've been playing this for a long time

No lag whatsoever epic population limits amazing units. Definitely a PC quality game similar to a supreme commander dumbed down a bit for ios. The only issues I have are the lack of any multiplayer and the small amount of units. There is also only one nation to play as and maps are relatively small. However this is all to be expected for a good RTS on your phone. Countless hours of fun, highly recommended.

Turret AI is now completely screwed up. Rather than fire upon all targets that enter there engagement range, they now only fire up on enemies when they themselves are attacked. This makes them very useless, and it makes me have to order them to attack incoming units to stop the enemy from damaging my turrets, because repairing them is so friggin annoying. Also renders the Bertha Long Range Artillery useless, as they will never fire at anything unless you order them too. needs fixed. alot . 2nd point. Newts are crap. Get rid of them and just use a repair building function PLEASE. 3rd, make the AI build and use mega units other than that stupid magna lase. That thing should almost be removed entirely, it's completely unbalanced. Pretty much whoever has access to the resource that lets you build the thing wins.
Also that eel electro shock sub is incredibly annoying. It's nearly impossible to counter, especially since my eels will not fire unless attacked. Since they've already been stunned, useless. Definatly needs some balancing to this game. Once it's done though, this will be the best RTS on the iPhone.

title.label: Ok RTS, still lots of bugs

content.label: I like the game play.  I hate that they still haven fixed many of the bugs.  Max units does not respect the setting and is always 500.  Now with the last update, resuming a game does not work. I'm about done waiting for these guys to get their act together.

L.A.S.W is an outstanding RTS for ios and a fan of this genre should definitely buy this game. I have put in countless hours of gameplay and I'm still having fun. Great AI challenges even the most experienced players. Now that an update has come out, I now know that the developer has not given up on this game and can't wait to see what they bring out in future updates.
Need more updates

title.label: Great RTS game from a great developer

content.label: I so largely back this developer for taking a three year old game and updating it with iPhone 5 screen support.

title.label: Great Game But Has Annoying Glitches

content.label: This is a great game and can be very addictive but there are major bugs. These bugs existed before the last update and were never corrected. An example is many times not having control of your units. I can have 50 aircraft in the game but can't control them. Instead it will have a turret or power building selected which does me no good. Hopefully they finally get these issues corrected.
